tool_description: The Image Edit API is a powerful and easy-to-use tool for Android developers looking to add image editing capabilities to their apps. With this API, you can easily resize, rotate, flip, blur, adjust contrast, and brightness of images. Additionally, you can apply presets to images, allowing you to quickly achieve a certain style or look.  One of the unique features of our API is the ability to create multi-batch images, which allows users to create images that combine multiple images into one....
name: Image Edite API
title: Image Edite API

api_list.name: Android image
api_list.description:
It's likely that the API is designed for generating icons for use in various contexts, such as on mobile devices, desktop applications, or web pages. Each of the sizes listed likely corresponds to a different use case, and may be optimized for different display densities, screen sizes, or visual styles.

Here is a brief explanation of some of the most common icon sizes:

29x29, 40x40, 60x60: These are sizes commonly used for icons on iOS devices.
57x57, 72x72, 76x76, 120x120, 152x152, 167x167, 180x180: These are sizes commonly used for icons on web pages, and may also be used for iOS or Android apps.
1024x1024: This is a high-resolution size that may be used for large icons or splash screens on some platforms.
It's possible that the API you are using allows you to specify which sizes you want included in the returned zip file. You may want to consult the API documentation or contact the API provider for more information on how to use the API effectively.
